title: Initial call to .cuda() very slow with Titan X
body_html:
The first call to .cuda() takes more than one minute when run on a system with a titan X:

import torch
from datetime import datetime

for i in range(10):
    x = torch.randn(10, 10, 10, 10) # similar timings regardless of the tensor size
    t1 = datetime.now()
    x.cuda()
    print(i, datetime.now() - t1)

0 0:02:01.451538
1 0:00:00.000205
2 0:00:00.000057
3 0:00:00.000058
4 0:00:00.000053
5 0:00:00.000054
6 0:00:00.000052
7 0:00:00.000051
8 0:00:00.000059
9 0:00:00.000051

Swapping a GTX 980ti on the exact same system results in normal timings (although with a very slight delay for the first call). On my laptop (GTX 960M), it is almost instant.

import torch
from datetime import datetime

    print(i, datetime.now() - t1)
